intro: Taraxacum pobedimoviae, commonly known as the Pobedimov's dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and latex-producing stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to harsh, alpine environments. Its yellow flower heads consist of numerous small florets, and it produces a distinctive, hollow stem with milky sap. Taraxacum pobedimoviae is considered a rare and endemic species, with limited distribution and specific ecological requirements.
